_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

This Executive Summary contains Dandy Cooling Company - OXS's administrative and operational programs to prevent ammonia-related accidents and reduce potential risks.  The regulated substance of concern and focus of this document is anhydrous ammonia.  The following topics are addressed in this Executive Summary:

-	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
-	Stationary Source and Regulated Substance
-	Hazard Assessment Summary
-	Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
-	Five Year Accident History
-	Emergency Response Program
-	Planned Changes to Improve Safety

The following Data Elements sections are attached as part of the EPA RMP submittal:

Section 1:	Registration Information
Section 2:	Toxics - Worst Case Release 
Section 3:	Toxics - Alternative Release 
Section 6:	Five Year Accident History 
Section 7:	Prevention Program 3 Component 
Section 9:	Emergency Response Component

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Dandy Cooling Company - OXS is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program. This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the process equipment at the facility.  

Dandy Cooling Company - OXS's management is also committed to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. Dandy Cooling Company - OXS's safety and environmental policies as they relate to the ammonia refrigeration system are administered by the General Manager, who conducts periodic inspections of the facility to ensure compliance, and oversees the entire safety and environmental programs, including the California Accidental Release Prevention Program. It is Dandy Cooling Company - OXS's policy to implement appropriate control measures t

o prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  Unforeseeable, if such a release does occur; the facility will implement the Emergency Action Plan and contact appropriate authorities and safely evacuate the facility.  

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE

The Dandy Cooling Company - OXS's facility is located at 2640 Sturgis Road in Oxnard, California, which is approximately 1.5 miles south of Highway 101 and 0.2 miles east of Highway 1-Pacific Coast Highway. The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban with a mixture of industrial facilities and farming.

The ammonia system at Dandy Cooling Company - OXS was constructed in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations, codes, and standards including mechanical codes, fire codes, and building codes in place at the time of construction.

HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY

A complete and thorough description of the release scenarios can be found in the 2022 Hazard Assessment report.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

The Dandy Cooling Company - OXS ammonia system has many safety features.  Much of the safety of the systems are inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the systems. 

The PSM / RMP / CalARP program ensures that all security and safety procedures are addressed.  Staff is trained in operation, maintenance and emergency procedures related to the operation of the ammonia systems.  All pressure vessels in the ammonia systems are equipped with relief valves that vent to the water diffusion tank at a certain pressure set point. A preventative maintenance program assures that equipment is maintained and serviced on a regular schedule and that worn, aging, or defective components are replaced as required to maintain equipment in good operating condition.  Controls and safety devices are inspected regularly to ensure proper operation.
 
EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Dandy Cooling Company - OXS's facility

is a non-responding facility and has an emergency action plan (EAP) in effect. The Plan provides the emergency organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, and ammonia health hazards information needed during an emergency. This Plan is reviewed and updated at least once per year. This Plan was reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM / RMP / CalARP regulations.

In the event of an ammonia emergency, Dandy Cooling Company - OXS plans to evacuate all employees and alert the local emergency responders (fire department). Dandy Cooling Company - OXS personnel plan to coordinate emergency efforts with the fire department on a periodic and ongoing basis.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

Since taking ownership of the Dandy Cooling Company - OXS facility in August 2022, there have been no releases of ammonia that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantity of 100 pounds in 24 hours or that meet the CalARP reporting criteria for the Five-Year Accident History as specified above. In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from an ammonia release, nor any releases or "near misses" that warranted an internal incident investigation.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Currently, the facility is modifying its system to allow the facility to charge above the 10,000lb threshold putting the facility under the EPA RMP jurisdiction. As part of that process, the facility is currently completing a Management of Change procedure designed to highlight the health and safety risks associated with the proposed modifications. Those areas will include updates to the Process Safety Information, revised system drawings, further development of contractor safety and employee participation procedures among other things. Dandy Cooling Company - OXS personnel are committed to implementing these changes prior to accepting additional ammonia  storage onsite.
